metadata.title: How to Create YouTube Brand Account 2025: Business Channel Setup
metadata.description: Set up a YouTube Brand Account for business. Multiple managers and professional features.

hero.headline: How to Create YouTube Brand Account
hero.subheadline: Professional channel structure. Multiple managers, separate identity.

sections.content: A YouTube Brand Account separates your channel from your personal Google account. This enables multiple managers, professional branding, and easier future transfers. For businesses and serious creators, brand accounts are the way to go.

content.title: Multiple Managers
content.description: Add team members without sharing personal login.

content.title: Separate Identity
content.description: Channel not tied to personal Google account.

content.title: Transferable
content.description: Can transfer ownership. Important for business sale.

sections.title: Creating Brand Account
content: Sign in to YouTube with Google account
This creates a Brand Account automatically
Verify channel is under Brand Account in Settings
Add managers through Brand Account settings

content.title: Owner
content.description: Full control. Can delete channel. Can add/remove owners.

content.title: Manager
content.description: Full access except deleting channel and managing owners.

content.title: Communications Manager
content.description: Can reply to comments and manage community. Limited access.

faq.question: How to check if I have Brand Account?
faq.answer: YouTube Studio > Settings > Channel > See 'Advanced settings'. It shows account type. Brand Account shows 'This account is managed by a Brand Account.'

faq.question: Can I convert personal to Brand Account?
faq.answer: Yes—in YouTube Settings, 'Move channel to a Brand Account'. Creates Brand Account and moves content. Doesn't affect videos or subscribers.

faq.question: How many managers can I add?
faq.answer: Up to 50 managers per Brand Account. Plenty for most teams. Remove inactive managers periodically for security.

faq.question: Is Brand Account required?
faq.answer: No—personal accounts work fine for solo creators. Brand Account mainly useful for teams, businesses, or future transferability.
